Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "7", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/4363864772943089957/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "2337474998589616009", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2010-12-28T10:06:00+05:30", "updated": "2018-09-09T12:46:13+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxNTM2NDc3MzczNTE5Cm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2010/12/clay-slurries-on-chemical-tankers-capt.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/2337474998589616009", "title": "CLAY SLURRIES ON CHEMICAL TANKERS --  CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRloU02NFDI/AAAAAAAACcA/JHRomDYaCoc/s1600/CAPT+VADAKAYIL.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRloU02NFDI/AAAAAAAACcA/JHRomDYaCoc/s320/CAPT+VADAKAYIL.jpg\" width=\"290\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">KAOLIN CLAY SLURRIES<o:p></o:p></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">It is commonplace for the Framo pump cargo seals to leak en masse after you start recirculating Kaolin clay slurry at sea . &nbsp;Experience has show that the leaks stabilize after the cargo is discharged.&nbsp;</span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Discharging can be done with ships Framo pumps. &nbsp;If the cargo does not go ( small deepwel risers ) , then the only alternative is to use a Framo portable screw pump . &nbsp;A screw booster pump ashore is also needed. <o:p></o:p></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n</div>\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">IMPORTANT:&nbsp;&nbsp; RECIRC AT SEA, IS ABOUT FAST JET MOTION IMPINGEMENT THROUGH <span style=\"color: blue;\">SMALL DIA RECIRC NOZZLES FITTED ON DROPS AT BOTTOM</span>. IT IS ABOUT <span style=\"color: red;\">ELECTROSTATIC CHARGES</span> KEEPING THE SLURRY IN <span style=\"color: magenta;\">COLLOIDAL SUSPENSION.</span> </span></b><br />\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"></span></b><br />\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"></span></b><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br /></span></b></div>\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">\n</span><div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n</div>\n</b><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Product Information:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Kaolin, ( China Clay ) in solid form are being shipped to ECC international, Colonial terminals, Savannah, processed and re-exported as slurry.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">The slurries consists of 67 - 73 percent solids and 27 - 33 percent liquids and are used in the paper manufacturing industry.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">In the receiving end, the product will go directly to the pulp mills without further processing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">There are presently 2 grades of slurry being shipped from Savannah, i.e.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">&nbsp;<i>Capim GP formerly known as Hubergloss (Alphagloss) slurry<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><i>&nbsp;WP Slurry formerly known as Nanaimo W.P. - Filler slurry</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Common Chemical name&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; : Aluminum Silicate Hydroxide<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Appearance &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;: White (Off White)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Specific Gravity &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; : 1.73 - 1.81<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Boiling Point &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; : 100 C<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Freezing Point &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; : Approx. O degr. C<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">MARPOL category/ OS <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Shipping and Handling--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Before loading:<o:p></o:p></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Cargo tanks:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Tanks should be cleaned from previous cargo to normal \" water white \" standard, ( i.e. no traces of previous cargo, no odor, no loose coating or particles present ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Upon completion of normal cleaning, the tanks, pumps and lines should be thoroughly rinsed and flushed with fresh water, added with minimum 100 ppm Hydrogen Peroxide.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">The slurry is extremely sensitive to bacteria, and may go off color and become unsuitable for its intended use if bacteria are allowed to grow. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">This is one of the main concerns of the shippers, and bacterial tests of tanks may be carried out prior to loading.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">The tanks presented for loading must furthermore be 100 percent coated, small areas with rust or pittings should be grinded and overcoated prior arrival at loading port. No particles, such as rust, coating flakes, grit or lint from wiping rags will be accepted, as these will appear as tears in the finished paper.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Cargo pumps: Frank Mohn recommend filling of&nbsp; fresh water into pump cofferdams. All cofferdams should be filled 100 % prior to arrival at loading port.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">After loading:<o:p></o:p></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">All cargo pipe lines must be thoroughly cleaned with fresh water as soon as possible upon completion of loading, not to allow drying of the product in any part of the line system, once dried it is virtually impossible to remove&nbsp;</span><span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 18px;\">Make sure the water flushed through the lines is absolutely clear (not milky).&nbsp; Check all drains and blanks.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 18px;\"><br />\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">(Recommended temp. of cleaning water: 40&nbsp; 50 degr. C )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Voyage <o:p></o:p></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">To avoid solids settling, it is necessary to recirculate the products during transit, this should be done via a hose from the pump stack through a tank cleaning hatch---bottom to top recirc, <strong><span style=\"color: blue;\">on ship's without recirc diffusers</span></strong> . </span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><em>Diffusers build up a electrostatic charge which keeps the colloids from getting agglomerated/ flocculated and settling down on the bottom of tank toform a sediment which cements the deepwell pump impeller..</em></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Shippers recommend pumps to be run at minimum speed during recirculation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">The fresh water level in the pump cofferdams must be controlled and maintained during this operation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">The solids in the Alphagloss product settle quickly, hence daily recirculation is necessary.&nbsp; A similar problem has not been experienced with the other products, and recirculation once a week should be sufficient. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Should clogging, of impeller nevertheless occur, it is recommended to blow the pump stack with compressed air, to brake up solids forming in the impeller housing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Discharging<o:p></o:p></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Discharging can be done with ships Framo pumps. If the cargo does not go , then the only alternative is to use a Framo portable screw pump. A screw booster pump ashore is also needed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Water level in cofferdams should be maintained during&nbsp; discharge operation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">The discharge rate vary from grade to grade and is generally slow in the beginning, be patient, for once the cargo is flowing, the rate will gradually increase.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Shore line will be pigged between each grade.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">The Alphagloss grade must be agitated ( recirculated ) prior to and during discharging,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">experience has proved that this grade is extremely difficult to pump due to the high<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">content of solids, hence extra care is required. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">The other grades does not require any agitation during discharging and will not represent any problem.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Upon completion of discharging, 2-3 cub. meter of unpumpable sediments will remain<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">in each tank hence sweeping is recommended. Tanks should be thoroughly ventilated<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">prior to entry, as the anti bacterial chemicals in the slurry can cause some irritation to the<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">eyes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Cleaning with fresh water is advantageous as the clay dissolves easily, sea water should be avoided as the clay mixes poorly and solids settle quickly.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Lukewarm water was recommended by shippers, but not a must. Experience showed no difference whether cold or warm water was used.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Tank cleaning procedure</span></b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"> after clay slurry.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">1 ) Upon completion of discharging and sweeping of tank,&nbsp; the tank should be closed&nbsp; down to keep the clay from drying on the walls. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">2) Cleaning should commence as soon as possible after the tank is empty, by using portable tank cleaning machines placed at the height of the cargo level.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">3) Only fresh water should be used for washing, and the tank should be washed for 20 minutes, and washings transferred into slop tank.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">4) Spot washing can be done with hand hose.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">5) Flush cargo line from pumpstack to manifold and then to the slop tank.Open and flush all drain cocks on cargo line, stripping line, drop line and heat exchangers, blow all pump cofferdams by air to empty them from water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">6) Open and check all cargo lines for residues of clay, and flush by fresh water if&nbsp; required. Final fresh water wash of tank of 30 min can be pumped overboard if the water is not milky. There is no pollution concern , but too much milkiness can cause sea to be stained white.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">7) Open all drains , flanges etc and check for residue.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">8) Steam lines.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">Clay slurry reacts with Co2 in atmosphere&nbsp; and hardens. Do not mix different grades of slurry in slop tank (reaction between different ionic type)\u2014pump direct overboard if feasible. Since it swamps the bottom environment\u2014take permission from local authority before pumping out in territorial waters.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><br />\n</span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\"><i>This can be explained by this experiment. Take a Kaolin slurry watery mixture and pour it into a pit made in sand. Do NOT expect the water to drain, it will remain there. The clay colloids will immediately block the pores in the loose sand.</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span class=\"Apple-style-span\" style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 18px;\">Ordinary slurries ( not clay ) react with CO2 and hardens. Avoid hot interface,a nd dump the washwater directly overboard\u2014not into slops. Do not mix different grade slops, due to anionic/ cationic reaction.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; line-height: 115%;\">-------CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"></span><br />\n<ol id=\"bc_0_114TB\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_113B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c6330932376293985413\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_113M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/09/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load_5.html?showComment=1536476807130#c6330932376293985413\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">September 9, 2018 at 12:36 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_113MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<br /><span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: x-large;\"><b>RUSH RUSH RUSH !<br /><br />WARNING-- WARNING-- WARNING !</b></span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">THIS CRITICAL MESSAGE MUST FIND THE EYES OF CM OF KERALA PINARAYI VIJAYAN NOW !</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">######################################################</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">WHY IS KUTTANAD STILL FLOODED WITH WATER ?</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">WHY IS THE WATER NOT BEING ABSORBED BY THE GROUND AS USUAL-- NEVER MIND THAT THE FIELDS ARE BELOW THE LEVEL OF THE SEA-- THIS IS IRRELEVANT..</span><br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">KUTTANAD IS NOW COVERED BY A LAYER oF FINE SILT , WHICH IS COLLOIDAL TOP SOIL FROM HIGHER AREAS , WHEN CAME DOWN WITH THE FLOODS..</span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">THIS SILT ACTS AS A WATER BARRIER.. font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">When my ship berthed at Ho Chi Minh city, &nbsp;I did some research in a nearby friendship village with the help of a workshop owner (who was an ex-colonel and a honourable man ).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">I learnt first hand about the crimes against humanity and the largest environmental disaster to this planet , by the US government.</span></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">I got to see secret pictures of raped and devastated forests.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">For some time I used to see nightmares of children in these pictures with cleft lips, shredded skins with limbs curled up . There were some children like a ball with NO human form , faces or brains. These deformed monsters were blind and could make only inhuman sounds. Some had 4 toes on the mangled feet.</span></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Dring the Vietnam war, from 1961 to 1971, the US military sprayed Vietnam with Agent Orange, which contained large quantities of Dioxin, in order to defoliate the trees for so called military objectives. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">In his frustration of not being able to win this difficult war in &nbsp;guerilla friendly jungles ,using superior fire power , president JF Kennedy authorized the CRIMINAL use of Agent Orange, made by Monsanto&nbsp;.</span></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">&nbsp;It was to be sprayed from the air on Vietnam to exterminate people like cockroaches and to denude the land of food and rice crops. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">JFK who initiated this \u201coperation ranch hand \u201c may be burning in hell even as you read this blog.</span></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">It was President Nixon who finally halted this bizarre war tactic.&nbsp; In 1973, President Richard Nixon promised $3.25 billion in reconstruction aid to Vietnam \"without any preconditions.\" That aid was never granted by the subsequent governments.</span></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">&nbsp;And mind you some of them had secured Nobel prizes for peace. The Pope could Not care less.&nbsp; (100 communists who got killed in Tinnaman square were however canonized as saints by the Vatican\u2014it is a measure of their holiness ).</span></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Yet the soldiers who sprayed this chemical and was in indirect contact secured 1.52 billion per year for imaginary skin rashes , soft-tissue sarcomas and non-Hodgkin\u2019s lymphoma.</span></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">More than 5 million people were exposed to Agent Orange. The spraying covered 24.8 percent of the land area of Vietnam. It is estimated that a mind boggling 95000 tons of agent orange was sprayed by soldiers who had NIL conscience to exterminate 3 million fellow humans. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">And imagine Saddam Hussain is branded as the villain of this planet.</span></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">The&nbsp;process&nbsp;used&nbsp;in&nbsp;the manufacture of Agent Orange (a 50:50 combination of 2,4,5-trichlorophenoxyacetic acid and 2,4-dichlorophenoxyacetic acid) &nbsp;created extremely toxic by-products known as dioxins, which cause severe birth defects and rare cancers in humans.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Britain used them successfully in the war against Communist insurgents in Malaya in the 1950s. &nbsp;US just followed suit, after a decade \u2014as the Engish speakin\u2019 white man\u2019s legacy.</span></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">Agent&nbsp;Orange&nbsp;killed all humans, and fauna and it penetrated the waxy covering of leaves to poison the entire plant. 25 percent of lush green Vietnam look like the \u201cno-man\u2019s-land\u201d of World War 3.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">It will take 200 years to regenerate this land. font-size: 11pt;\">..</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div style=\"margin: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"color: black; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;\">..</span></div>\n</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "18", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/1449086357138824179/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "8861523870453003898", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2010-12-25T11:11:00+05:30", "updated": "2010-12-30T11:34:33+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxMjkzNjg5MDczNTk4Cm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2010/12/leadership-at-sea-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/8861523870453003898", "title": "LEADERSHIP AT SEA --  CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRWD0Ow16uI/AAAAAAAACWw/7qfufiLcbBQ/s1600/capt+ajit+vadakayil.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRWD0Ow16uI/AAAAAAAACWw/7qfufiLcbBQ/s1600/capt+ajit+vadakayil.JPG\" /></a></div><div class=\"MsoNormal\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">BLUE OCEAN LEADERSHIP-- CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: 11pt;\">\u201cYou cant sail her with just 2 men. You\u2019ll never get out of the harbour!\u201d</span></i><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: 11pt;\">\u201cSon, I\u2019m Captain Jack Sparrow, savvy?\u201d</span></i><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: 11pt;\">--- Johnny Depp ( cool dude adventurer) in Pirates of the Caribbean.</span></i><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Great achievers are rarely realistic by other peoples standards for they see problems as valuable feedback to help them steer a better course. It is your belief about your own capabilities , which force you to try on not to try . The comfort zone is a great enemy for courage and confidence. Set high goals and standards for yourself. Completely unrealistic goals however are a form of self delusion. Only a fool will try and delude himself into success.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Often my critics and my well wishers ask me why I self inflict and keep the Sword of Damocles dangling all the time over me . I tell them \u2013 it is mE style.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Here is the secret--<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Insecurity or the sword of Damocles is the chief propulsive power in this world. Some mavericks, like you know who-- welcome a certain amount of frustration as a challenge\u2014it gives them a kick to overcome it. Treat a quickened pulse caused by adrenaline rush as an ally \u2013and not as an enemy. You have the power now to convert fear into excitement, flight to fight.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">When people gun for them it gives a chance to prove themselves . Tactical anger has more to do than what meets the eye. You can now do things you would not have done normally. Some people need to feel angry in order to create enough leverage on themselves to make a change. Too little stress may be as harmful as too much stress, especially when you want to get a task done. Some stress or stimulation is needed for optimum performance\u2014this is termed positive stress response PSR. Optimum stimulation causes creativity and change. Performance rises as stress increases. Once a optimum point is crossed however, increasing stress impairs judgement and alertness and performance falls off. Too much stress causes panic and feeling of inability to cope.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Among all my mentoring pieces \u2014this is the only one I am fully qualified to write. Leader ship is an art which you practice, or it just remains a notion frustrating you with its elusiveness and tantalizing you with its possibilities. It is not a concept, it is something you do. A lawyer practices law, a doctor practices medicine, a cook practices cooking\u2014same way a leader practices leadership.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Leadership is not what you learn in management schools and books . Most such books are written by unqualified whiz kids, who consider a map more important than the terrain. They have never been higher than the base camp at the Himalayas\u2014but have written several books on how to conquer the Everest. Yeah, sure!&nbsp; Edmund Hillary had got drunk over a few bottles of beer and given them a scoop on a platter\u2014 sure, we believe that. Just as a champion bridge player does not emerge from a single session at the table, effective leadership simply does not happen without practice. You have to know what to hold and what to discard, when.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Hmmm! So what are my qualifications ---- I am from the land of thinkers, I have more than 6400 days of actual command on board merchant ships\u201424 hours of contextual leadership in every of those 6400 days . Very few souls on this planet have this type of quality/ quantity leadership-hour exposure. ( yeah! this is a bit like crane hook hours you fill on the cargo work abstract ! tee hee! )<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">People who have sailed with me will cry\u2014\u201cCapt Vadakayil never practiced a dang word of what he has written here \u201d. They are absolutely right. My maverick style has always been based on humor and the awe factor ( yeah, 16 kilo dumbbells were part of inducing this factor ).<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">This way I could kick the beehive, and the bees instead of stinging me to death , willingly parted with their piggy bank honey. They stole from other hives and gave me that too. But that does not mean I did not know what it takes . The clown of the trapeze show is usually the most versatile of the entire lot. Don\u2019t let his clumsiness fool you.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Now a ship\u2019s captain is not like the one size fits all , 9 to 5 shore company boss who operates in secure surroundings and will take bed rest if he feels queasy in the morning . This one trick pony\u2019s life is never at risk, when he has a security problem he uses his chair power ---there is a department to deal with it, if one of his team has a accident-- there is a specialist doctor available, if his faucet leaks-- he calls the plumber, if one of his managers gets run over by a truck when crossing the road to office , he is not hauled over the burning embers for not training the manager how to cross the road properly with a log entry authenticating the solemn deed.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">In short a \u201cone size fits all\u201d shore company CEO is not a 24 hour father figure. He rarely gets the opportunity to practice emotional or contextual leadership like a ships captain ,where he got to juggle diverse hats\u2014doctor, lawyer, judge , policeman, plumber, cook, barber, tailor, head shrink, journalist, politician, conciliator, party organizer, coach, diplomat, savior, plumber, engineer, metallurgist, referee, soldier without licence to kill&nbsp; \u2014you name it.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">This jack of all trades changes hats every few steps based on the context, culture , setting , direct/ indirect cues that demand a particular style of leadership\u2014where relevance, urgency and potential , relative to the need of his crew are dynamically assessed.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Contextual leadership does not seek to transcend the individual. A ship\u2019s crew is usually made up of individuals from a wide variety of backgrounds, ages, education, ethnicity, experience, and culture. You are responsible for a whole gang not so bright or brain dead that you did not pick, whom you cant smack or sack \u2013you are expected to accommodate them for the entire 4 month contract. Even if you get united nations good players , getting them to play together is the hard part..<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">The captain is often faced with a rapidly changing business environment, a single leadership style like a company manager cannot be expected to be effective with every person, or in every situation. The best leadership style is \"the style that works\". Here you take into account all the forces in the situation or \u201cthe context\u201d. It could be rough seas. How do you integrate these forces so you can select the style that is most effective, the one that produces the best outcome for the company, the charterer,, the crew, the weather and the situation . The context determines your next move.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">You have an idea of a contextual \u201c flammability composition graph\u201d which is used on board tankers to keep away from the explosion cup ? Knowing the characteristics of each context is the beginning of deciphering the mysteries of leadership . How you lead depends on Who, What, Where, and When you lead. You must know how to adapt or change your leadership approach as the conditions evolve and maturity levels.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Success in one realm does not always translate into success in another. Indeed, superintendents relying on obsolete management school powered past models of success without being sensitive to the context of the situation , and ignoring the dynamic needs to choose afresh , has often caused disaster at sea.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">This piece is about futuristic blue ocean leadership. The land lubbers can use this too as it is tailored for their use\u2014they can call it blue sky leadership and feel comfortable. Here you don\u2019t have to be grey or dull or boring\u2014you can be exciting, adventurous, innovative\u2014whatever you decide to be, you must be consistent. No one else knows that you can work miracles\u2014but you know you can do it , deep down\u2014and that is what is important.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">A good leader has the technique to get extra ordinary performance from ordinary people. He can take his team to places they would not have gone by themselves . He will reinvent his industry instead of just simply trying to lead it. He is capable of generating good solutions for difficult problems. He will not give up easily and can recover quickly when faced with setbacks. He can understand , accept and is sensitive to individual differences. He prevents his team from stagnating and losing touch with reality. He stands at the teams point of balance. He is aware of his teams pulse and emotional undercurrents. He is consistent, fair, upright, no-bull kind of leader , treats everyone with dignity and can listen. He can understand his employers perspective. That is why he wears the mystique and the style \u2014the air of power , honour and dignity , and he is trusted and respected.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">On board my ship , every month end there is a meeting with everybody sharing a failure ( near miss/ incident/ hazard ) --- to find out what people have to offer, to allow them to contribute the valuable experience they have collected from other experiences and companies, to involve the entire team in problem identification , goal setting, to develop an action plan, and to evaluate own their work. Based on such meetings I usually have the crew list marked with\u2014competent, committed, architect, mason\u2014so that a effective threesome or foursome team can be made. A Big Moose/ Dilton team is more effective with the menacing beach bums than 2 Diltons or 2 Mooses.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Management that perceives order as its mission and chaos as the enemy will totally miss the opportunities present when the established structures fall away, allowing for the creation of new and more appropriate ones. Einstein said\u2014you can never solve a problem with the same kind of thinking that created the problem in the first place . After the Kobe earth quake\u2014the Japanese still did not learn their lessons\u2014they still made top heavy houses on stilts with paper walls.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Annual seminars give each employee the unique opportunity to take a high level look at the company and its direction\u2014thus encouraging every one to spend a couple of days living and thinking like the CEO. Employees could then examine their own challenges from a different perspective and encourage each other to be more creative and innovative. This is very different from our own EMS seminars which is more like a collective bargaining agreement ,free for all, with vested interests rubbing their hands in anticipation from the sidelines , for the fallout spoils.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Innovation involves tangential lateral thinking, approaching tasks from unexpected angles, challenging assumptions, irreverence to consensual views, lack of respect for past custom , rocking the boat and challenging rules. Innovations initially tend to be less efficient that existing methods.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Management as taught in prestigious management schools and practiced currently worldwide is a science. Inventories can be managed, people must be led-by example. There can be no bad soldiers under a good general who exudes confidence and can never break into a sweat. .. Leadership strives to accomplish change, whereas management focuses on maintaining equilibrium while achieving results using the late working drones and the worker ants. A manager has to manage processes rather than people for people can manage themselves if you let them..<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Leaders think for the great using imagination and intuitive powers. Managers with analytical , number crunching monkeys riding their backs , just stereo type, working for the good. The biggest enemy of great is good. Once you have a good enough solution, it takes a lot of effort and courage and brainpower to look for even better ways.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">A managers job is to create stability and deal with reality. A leaders job is to stir emotion and set audacious , grandiose goals that shake the status quo. Management uses an explicit set of tools and techniques, based on reasoning and testing, that can apply to a variety of situations. Leadership has fewer explicit tools. Too much management and you stagnate. Too much leadership and trend setting , and you get nowhere. Embrace the challenge of striking the balance.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Many managers follow the notion of busy fools and confuse hard work with long hours. They feel they must be bloody good if they push the mouse 16 hours a day.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Management is more formal and scientific than leadership. It relies on foundation skills such as planning and controlling. Leadership requires eliciting teamwork and motivating people.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">A leader makes frequent use of his or her imagination and creative problem-solving techniques to bring about change. A manager tends to make frequent use of standard, well-established solutions to problems.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">A leader frequently displays enthusiasm, passion, and inspiration to get others to attain high levels of performance. Managing involves less outward emotion and a more conservative demeanor to achieve goals once they are defined.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Many managers mistake task assignment for delegating. Task assignment is just a routine work which is autocratically demanded and seen by the employee as a burden. Here the main focus is action. Delegation produces growth, must be negotiated as it could be misunderstood and it requires commitment. The leadership style here is laissez-faire. The things the leader knows the best is delegated. By delegating he shares his knowledge. He gives people the opportunity for broader experiences. He will get his employees to volunteer themselves and not wait for someone to discover how great he really is.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Rely strongly on intuition and think out of the box when solving problems. Take pride in your ability to generate alternate solutions. There is a better way to do things than what has been done in the past. Have a child like approach\u2014not caring what others think. See a problem from all perspectives and do upside down thinking. Permit others to tear down your ideas and so that you may rebuild it . Have the strength of character to battle entrenched resistance to change. I was witness to such spirited resistance at leaderless Trogir shipyard where I stayed 6 weeks for delivery of chemical tanker Siteam Explorer. The management could not even make the yard workers wear helmets\u2014that says it all.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Practise tip of the iceberg thinking. Treat every unexpected event as an indication of a trend. Rethink means turning the problems you face on its head or approaching it backwards. It could mean challenging all fundamental assumptions. Intuition is an accelerated form of thinking where the disparate parts of a problem suddenly snaps into place like the pieces of a jigsaw\u2014the answer just feels right. Rethink could mean pull instead of push.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Richard Branson had come to the campus of Delhi IIT in the third week of Jan 2008 , with the British PM for a tete e tete with the students. He was the first in the world to apply futuristic open page thinking by hiring people who did not have a background in the airline industry\u2014 all of them Virgin ( now don\u2019t ask me if that is literal for the British air hostesses tee hee !! ) , except the pilots.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">The MD of Univan had applied this 16 years back when he employed a ordinary lawyer as the head of Safety Dept ( the man turned out to be overbearing and overwrought \u2013that is another story ). Vroon Breskens had employed a land lubbing management guru as their technical director 12 years back\u2014he would not know the difference between a cast and a die or port from starboard \u2014but he did have the ability to pull the lens back.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Leadership as it used to be is no longer appropriate. Leadership as command and control is defeated even before it starts by the chaotic conditions of our times. In our times of huge change the leader is not in control over the normal levers of power.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Leadership is like shining a torch beam \u2013you need to know where to shine it and for how long. You shine it in the wrong place or at the wrong time you put the adventure at peril and lose respect. Imagine a scenario where you are the leader of a school bus load of boy scouts and girl guides\u2014you are trying to reach safety after a picnic and your bus breaks down in a dark forest before an impending storm. You have a torch which you have to put to optimum use before the batteries run out.. This calls for anticipation and intuition.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Decide what is right before you decide what is possible. If every possible obstacle must first be overcome, nothing will ever get done. Make firm decisions about the things you want\u2014burn your mental bridges behind you. Over concern for the approval of others can paralyse you ability to take effective action.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Good leaders must have emotional vocabulary. Words are triggering devices to instantly heighten or lower emotions . Have you ever been deeply moved by a great communicator. On the walls of my old school was posted the great letter by Abraham Lincoln to a school teacher \u2014on how to mould his son-- I have yet to see someone who was not deeply moved by this great piece of communication. Why don\u2019t you read this para and check out if you feel touched? Caution: the brain dead must stay away.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Quote\u2014<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Try to give my son the strength not to follow the crowd when everyone is getting on the bandwagon...<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">In school, teach him it is far more honorable to fail than to cheat.....<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Teach to have faith in his own ideas, even if everyone tells him he is wrong.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Teach him to be gentle with gentle people and tough with the tough.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Teach him to listen to all men; but teach him also to filter all he hears on a screen of truth, and take only the good that comes through.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Teach him, if you can, how to laugh when he is sad... Teach him there is no shame in tears.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Teach him to scoff at cynics and to be beware of too much sweetness.. Teach him to sell his brawn and brain to highest bidders, but never to put a price on his heart and soul. Teach him to close his ears to a howling mob.. and stand and fight if thinks he is right.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">He will have to learn, I know, that all men are not just and are not true. But teach him if you can, the wonder of books.. but also give him quiet time to ponder the eternal mystery of birds in the sky, bees in the sun and flowers on a green hillside.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Treat him gently, but do not cuddle him, because only the test of fire makes fine steel. Let him have the courage to be impatient.. Let him have the patience to be brave. Teach him always to have sublime faith in himself, because then he will have faith in humankind.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">This is a big order, but see what you can do. . He is such a fine little fellow my son!<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">- Abraham Lincoln\"---<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Unquote<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Words have the power to start wars or create peace. People with impoverished vocabularies do not have the multi hued palette of colours to paint their life\u2019s experiences for them selves or for others. Leadership requires first and foremost excellent communication skills combined with listening skills. That is how context and cultural sensitivities are sensed and converted in suggestions and actions<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Intuitive transition management might be deemed by conventional wisdom and number crunchers as beyond the edge of the frivolous. Imagination plus a sense of wonder creates vision from which futures are made.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">A vision is an idealized scenario of the future of an organization\u2014a goal that entices people to work toward a rosy future. A leader creates the vision and a strategy to reach the vision; a manager uses a set of skills to work toward achieving the vision<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Now, vision is not a policy statement or the product of a committee. Vision emerges from the depths. It has a lot to do with the powers of intuition and the operation of the RH side of the brain. Einstein apparently heard his visions as music which he later translated into mathematics.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Visionaries are driven people. They see things that others do not see , march to a different drummer, play by new rules. They tend to be strange and difficult to get along with. If visionaries are compulsive they are also frustrating, for they tend to talk in repetitive circles, like you know who-- struggling to bring their object of awareness into focus. Their compulsions give them the appearance of certainty. Their lack of clarity often make them an object of scorn. An example of a visionary was Da Vinci who was centuries ahead of his time. Your vision is the blue print of your achievements. Don\u2019t let vision be a mirage, or an unrealistic pie in the sky thinking.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Some managers feel threatened if others do not fit in to their stereotype mould. They do not understand that every human being is different and dictated to by his own will and heart and mind. Generally, less experienced or insecure managers will tend to lean on the more authoritarian types of leadership because they desire the title of leader to bolster their self-esteem, and they lack confidence in their skills. Talented, mature leaders employ the most appropriate style based on the context. Through all leadership situations, you must find a style of leadership most suited to the occasion that balances your own maturity and capabilities and the group's maturity and ability.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Emergency situations do not lend themselves to consultation or delegation or for a show of hands like in the Lok Sabha.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Marine engineers who move up to shore management often face an adjustment period that involves adopting a whole new skill- and mindset. They must let go of their affinity for hard numbers and straightforward answers, and learn to embrace ambiguity. \" In management, there's no right or wrong,\" --There are only effective answers.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Management deals with ambiguity, with situations where answers don't exist in a right-and-wrong structure. I believe management is a whole new career for tunnel visioned marine engineers.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Thinking is nothing but the process of asking and answering questions. What drives our behavior however is -- gut reactions , neuro-associations linked to pain and pleasure \u2014not intellectual calculations. To create a new behavior you have to simply rewire yourself. All decisions are driven by your unconscious desire to achieve pleasure values and avoid your pain values. All are pushed by one value and pulled back my another. Decision making is nothing but values clarification. We all have a miniature court system set up in our brains . Our personal rules are the ultimate judge and jury. Next time you get upset with somebody \u2013remember\u2014you are not upset with that person. You are reacting to your own rules for the situation. Use this pattern interruptus ( no\u2014it is not like coitus interruptus tee hee!! ) to refocus on how to communicate in a better fashion, to avoid conflict.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div align=\"center\" class=\"separator\" style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in; text-align: center;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">HARD TRUTHS to forge the BOL mindset.--<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Debates rarely progress beyond thesis and anti thesis. The usual effect is to leave each side more deeply entrenched in their original position. On the contrary ,when you brainstorm what remains at the end is wisdom.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">There is no training course or book for the unwritten rules, that make you a good leader.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Each person has two sides to his personality\u2014the analytical and the intuitive.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Thinkers learn to trust the latter.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Tact is the art of making a point without making an enemy.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Good behavior is the last refuge of mediocrity. Check out the well behaved , non controversial , Rosgolla sweet guys around you and see how good they are!<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">There is always magic in the first attempt. IAS gold medalist-- 3rd attempt , hardly has a sheen.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">For a man who has no idea whether he is sailing Ganga bajoo or Jamuna bajoo\u2014no wind is the right wind.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Rather be saved by criticism than be ruined by praise.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">When all is lost the future still remains.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">May a true word is said in jest.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Credibility stems from what you do\u2014not what you say.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">The wheel that squeaks gets the grease. Another school of thought--The wheel that squeaks the loudest before a long journey gets replaced.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Unless you value yourself you will not value your time.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">A weak mind is like a microscope which magnifies trifling things \u2013but just cannot receive the great ones.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">The stupid are always cock sure- it is the intelligent ones who are full of doubt.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Creative minds have been known to survive all bad training and bad company..<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Only when it is dark enough , you can see the stars. An engineer can prove his mettle only when his machinery breaks down.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">It is all right if somebody lets go once in a while \u2013as long as he can get himself back.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">People with self esteem are usually cheerful \u2013yes!<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Failure is often the result of neglecting to make that call \u2013 or to go that extra mile.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Gifted men need to be challenged constantly in order to excel.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Most problems well defined are already half solved.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Unhappiness is very often nothing but a bad habit.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">If a man does only what is required of him he is a slave\u2014the moment he does more he is a free man.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">There are two kinds of discontent in this world\u2014one that works and the other that wrings its hands. There is no cure for the first type, but success\u2014there is no cure at all for the second.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Knowledge is power only when it is put into action ( the old proverb need to be amended )\u2014if you do not use knowledge , it remains potential power only.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">A lot of us see\u2014very few observe. Most sleepwalk through life without paying any attention to the infinite possibilities around.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Courtesy is the lubricant of society. Probably this should be mE resolution for 2009--. to be courteous when I feel like bloodying some jack ass\u2019s nose.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">The absence of fear is either the lack of imagination of intelligence or of the will to live. Fear however is a good creative force.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">All great thinkers and inventors were ridiculed at first. It is a human failing to deride new ideas or efforts. The thing to do is to laugh at the scoffers and go right ahead and do what you feel is right.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Business is an intuitive activity involving hunches and gut feeling. Computers can NEVER be business leaders.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">For dreams to mature they need a period of incubation. Leave them in the attic of your mind for too long , and mould gathers. Bring them out in the open too soon they get evaporate.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Creativity requires a challenge.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Watch out for minions for whom pleasing a superior can become more important than campaigning for or doing the things he believes is right for the organization.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">It is great to find at work an outlet for skills and abilities beyond those for which one was explicitly hired.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">When a problem crops up again and again\u2014it means the root cause is hidden, and you have to dig deeper.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><br />\n</div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\"><span style=\"color: black; font-size: 11pt;\">Drive for consensus and fear of conflict drives the company towards mediocrity.<o:p></o:p></span></div><div style=\"margin-bottom: .0001pt;
